title.narrative: Uruguay - Banking and Financial Services. Uruguay - Banking and Financial Systems

description.narrative: Governance refers to the exercise of political, economic, and administrative authority to manage a country's affairs at all levels, including the capacity to formulate, implement, and enforce public policies and deliver services. Good governance includes modes of administrative authority that are inclusive, participatory, transparent, responsive, effective, and accountable. This includes support for strengthening legislatures and local governments; capacity-building; security sector reform; separation of powers through institutional checks and balances, between the executive and legislative branches, in particular; and avenues within government structures for accountability, oversight and meaningful public participation. In conflict or post-conflict environments, this includes support for reconstruction of state institutions and systems.

Support the establishment of a sound private, well-functioning, equitable financial sector that fulfills critical roles in a market economy, most importantly financial intermediation – the efficient generation and allocation of savings to their most productive use.

This award strives to support the establishment of a sound private, well-functioning, equitable financial sector that fulfills critical roles in a market economy. More specifically, this includes The intermittent advisor is working to build institutional capacity at COPAB. Specific assistance in the bank resolution area is helping to organize COPAB into an independent, efficient agency able to support renewed growth in the banking sector. The project will equip COPAB with fast-response capability and a range of options should it be required to address bank failure at some future point. At the Superintendency of Financial Institutions, the advisors are working to strengthen bank supervision capacity through a combination of training and technical assistance. The project aims to bring the policies and operational capacity of the Superintendency of Financial Institutions up to international standards, particularly with respect to recent developments in macro-prudential regulation, the supervision of treasury operations, and expected Basel III guidelines. The advisors are also working to assist the Superintendency in establishing Financial Stability Committee as an independent entity able to carry out relevant modeling and analytical work in the sector.. Building institutional capacity at COPAB. Specific assistance in the bank resolution area will contribute to organize COPAB into an independent, efficient agency able to support renewed growth in the banking sector. The project will equip COPAB with fast-response capability and a range of options should it be required to address bank failure at some future point. Strengthening of bank supervision capacity through a combination of training and technical assistance, the project will aim at bringing the policies and operational capacity of the Superintendency of Financial Institutions up to international standards, particularly with respect to recent developments in macro-prudential regulation, the supervision of treasury operations, and expected Basel III guidelines. The project will aim at establishing a Financial Stability Committee as an independent entity able to carry out relevant modeling and analytical work in the sector..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The primary goal of U.S. assistance is to bolster Uruguayan engagement in international affairs, advance Uruguay's security sector reform, support military professionalization, and prepare the armed forces to counter emerging threats at home and abroad. Uruguay's commitment to international engagement makes it an important U.S. partner in global efforts to foster democracy, prosperity, and rule of law. Uruguay has a remarkable record as a contributor to peacekeeping operations and remains one of the top per capita police and troop contributors to United Nations peacekeeping missions. Military education and training is a key component of the U.S. government's commitment to enhancing security cooperation and strengthening Uruguay's national defense capabilities. This training also helps strengthen and maintain Uruguay's peacekeeping and disaster response capabilities.
